item.title: EZVIZ introduces new action cameras
item.description: Source: EZVIZ. The FIVE action cam. EZVIZ, a company specializing in Wi-Fi cloud cameras and video surveillance equipment, will introduce a new action camera series at CES 2016, designed for sports enthusiasts and content creators. Priced at US$299.99, the EZVIZ FIVE action camera boasts an Ambarella A12 chipset, a built-in 2-inch IPS touchscreen with 320x240 resolution, a 900mAh battery, and the capability to record continuously at 4K resolution at 15 frames per second.

item.title: The Altec Lansing Freedom True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds come with noise isolation and GPS tracking
item.description: Source: Altec Lansing. The Freedom True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds have rechargeable lithium ion batteries. Altec Lansing’s new Freedom True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds offer a truly wireless experience, featuring rechargeable lithium-ion batteries integrated into the earbud housings. These innovative earbuds boast a six-hour battery life, IPX7-rated waterproof construction for sweat resistance, and Bluetooth-based GPS tracking to easily locate misplaced earbuds. Expected to launch in the second quarter of 2016 with a manufacturer’s suggested retail price of US$149.

item.title: LG will be showcasing its newest Ultra monitors at CES
item.description: At CES, LG Electronics (LG) will showcase its newest Ultra monitors, featuring UltraWide models for productivity and UltraGear monitors designed for gaming. 2019 LG UltraWide Monitor Source: LG. The new 49" UltraWide monitor. Known for its innovation in the UltraWide monitor market, LG’s latest 49-inch model (49WL95) offers a 32:9 aspect ratio curved screen designed to enhance productivity. Its size is equivalent to two 27-inch Quad High Definition displays combined, with a resolution of 5,120 x 1,440 and 108 pixels per inch for clarity.

item.title: L’Oréal introduces a flexible skin sensor that tracks sun exposure
item.description: Source: L’Oréal. Model wearing a My UV patch. L’Oréal recently introduced My UV Patch at the Consumer Electronics Show. It is the first flexible skin sensor designed to track UV exposure and promote sun-safety awareness among consumers. This innovation arrives as sun exposure has become a significant health concern, with 90% of non-melanoma skin cancers linked to ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun, in addition to skin pigmentation and premature aging.

item.title: Mobile app-driven ATMs without screens could be the future of banking
item.description: EyeLock, a company that provides iris-based identity authentication solutions, has partnered with Diebold, a global provider of self-service technology, to create a screenless, compact ATM concept. A prototype called Irving is currently being tested by Citibank in the US. This innovative ATM design eliminates the need for a PIN pad, card reader, or screen. Instead, users conduct transactions through a mobile app on their smartphone. The system utilizes near field communication (NFC), quick response (QR) code technology, and EyeLock’s iris scanning to verify the customer’s identity at the ATM.
